segments.text: This whole scene makes me incredibly nervous, I must admit.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading so quickly across the floor, it's bound to be slippery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can just imagine someone, perhaps the woman or one of the children, taking a nasty fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And that stool the boy is on, it's listing at such an angle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He could easily lose his balance and come crashing down, plate and all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's such a shame, this quiet domestic moment turning into a potential accident zone.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could reach in and stop the faucet or steady that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman seems so peaceful in her task, completely unaware of the dangers.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like a ticking time bomb, this kitchen, waiting for something to go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they all manage to avoid any injuries from this situation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The image of broken dishes and a bumped head is really quite vivid in my mind.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a strange blend of everyday life and imminent peril.
segments.speaker: PAR
